definition: first signs/development (of a situation)
Hmong or Miao ethnic group of southwest China/surname Miao
sprout
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
suffix for nouns
to compete with (idiom) (Tw)/to pit oneself against

sentences.english: I think I had glimmerings of this perception many years ago when I was a graduate student.
sentences.chinese: 我想我是在多年前讀研究生時有了這種想法的苗頭。

sentences.english: Tight credit could suppress any rebound in spending, furthermore.
sentences.chinese: 此外，信貸緊縮可能抑制開支復甦苗頭。

sentences.english: Even in our small example, we can see this just beginning to happen.
sentences.chinese: 即使在我們這樣小的示例中，也可以看到混亂的苗頭。

sentences.english: It is early days, but those who see a leftward tilt have a case.
sentences.chinese: 儘管爲時還早，但那些看出左傾苗頭的人也不無理由。

sentences.english: Already, there are early signs of drought in the northern wheat-growing areas, Mr. Liu said.
sentences.chinese: 劉寧說，北方小麥產區已經出現了早期的乾旱苗頭。

sentences.english: “Threats have a hard time hiding in a calm environment, ” he said.
sentences.chinese: “危險苗頭在平靜的環境中難以產生，”他說。

sentences.english: Just as the timber war wound down, the tanker war began.
sentences.chinese: 但木材之爭剛剛平息下來，油輪對抗又冒出了苗頭。

definition: frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
lit. wind from an empty cave (idiom)/fig. unfounded (story)/baseless (claim)
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
unification and independence
to play deaf-mute
argument/view (sometimes derogatory)
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
use both carrot and stick/use gentle methods and force/an iron hand in a velvet glove
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
to correct an error
superstructure
to gesticulate while talking (idiom)/to explain by waving one's hands/to criticize or give orders summarily
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
lit. first impression is strongest
to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
indefinite/unclear
